intro: Caucalis melanantha, commonly known as the black-flowered caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, dark purple to black flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Caucalis melanantha typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
